prs.title: op-node: Search valid unsafe head backwards
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Changes the search for the latest valid unsafe head (valid per canonical L1 origin) in the supervisor-instructed reset to go backwards. L1 reorgs are usually shallow, and resets sometimes are for other reasons than an L1 reorg, so going backwards will almost always be a much quicker option.

**Tests**

Existing L1 reorg acceptance tests should still pass.

**Additional con

commits.message: op-node: Search valid unsafe head backwards

prs.title: op-batcher: more robust detection of not-ready `syncStatus`
prs.truncated_body:
This is a more robust way of detecting an invalid or "not yet ready" sync status. A valid status may have a `0` L2 safe block number, but the block hash would be the genesis block and therefore nonzero. 

This should also allow us to safely run the batcher with `--prefer-local-safe-l2=true` even before we have fully resolved #14576

commits.message:
op-batcher: inspect nullity of safe block ref in sync actions

this is a more robust way of detecting an invalid or "not yet ready" sync status
extend check to unsafe ref
fix test
retain check on HeadL1
fix test
neaten
widen generic type of isZero

prs.title: feat: Add StarkNet support to tBTC TypeScript SDK
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

This PR adds comprehensive StarkNet support to the tBTC TypeScript SDK, enabling Bitcoin deposits to StarkNet through the tBTC protocol. The implementation follows the established pattern for L2 chains while accommodating StarkNet's unique architecture (no L2 contracts, felt252 addresses, StarkGate bridge).

## Changes

### Core Implementation

- **Chain Definitions** (`src/lib

commits.message:
Add StarkNet support to the tBTC SDK

- Introduced StarkNet as a supported L2 chain in the SDK, including necessary modules and interfaces for cross-chain interactions.
- Implemented the StarkNet address handling and extra data encoding for deposits.
- Added artifacts for StarkNet L1 Bitcoin Depositor with placeholder values.
- Enhanced the EthereumL1BitcoinDepositor to support StarkNet deposits.
- Updated chain mappings to include StarkNet and added corresponding tests for functionality and integration.
- Comprehensive test coverage for new features, ensuring robust functionality and error handling.
chore: ran format:fix and docs
chore: build the project and run yarn docs

Enhance StarkNet support in tBTC SDK

- Added StarkNet ABI for tBTC token contract, enabling interaction with the token on StarkNet.
- Updated TypeScript configuration to target ES2020 and added skipLibCheck for improved type checking.
- Introduced StarkNetDepositor class for managing deposits and interactions with StarkNet.
- Implemented StarkNetTBTCToken class to support balance queries and token operations.
- Added comprehensive tests for new StarkNet functionalities, ensuring robust integration and error handling.

Add axios integration for StarkNet deposit initialization

- Implemented the `initializeDeposit` method in `StarkNetDepositorInterface` to call an external relayer service for cross-chain deposits.
- Added error handling for missing extra data and unexpected responses from the relayer.
- Introduced a new test suite for the StarkNet depositor interface, covering relayer interactions and error scenarios.
- Updated existing tests to skip unsupported operations now that the relayer functionality is implemented.

Enhance StarkNet API Reference and Implement New Classes

- Added `StarkNetDepositor` class for managing deposits with StarkNet, including support for deposit initialization through a relayer.
- Introduced `StarkNetDepositorConfig` and `StarkNetTBTCTokenConfig` interfaces for configuration management.
- Updated API reference documentation to include new classes and interfaces, improving clarity and accessibility.
- Enhanced `loadStarkNetCrossChainContracts` function to support balance queries with deployed tBTC contracts.
- Updated tests to cover new functionalities and ensure robust integration with StarkNet.

Refactor StarkNet TBTC Token and TBTC Service Initialization

- Updated StarkNetTBTCToken class to utilize the `call` method for balance queries, improving error handling and ensuring compatibility with StarkNet's read-only operations.
- Enhanced TBTC class to support a two-parameter pattern for cross-chain initialization, deprecating the single-parameter method. Added detailed documentation and error handling for parameter validation.
- Updated tests to cover new initialization patterns and ensure robust integration with StarkNet, including backward compatibility checks and improved mock provider behavior.
chore: format:fix & docs
chore: yarn.lock, formats & docs

feat: implement single-parameter mode for StarkNet initialization

- Add single-parameter mode detection in initializeCrossChain
- Single-parameter mode is now the primary pattern (no warnings)
- Two-parameter mode shows deprecation warning
- Extract StarkNet address from Account or Provider objects
- Maintain backward compatibility with Provider-only objects
- Add comprehensive test suite (11 tests)

This enables better UX where users only need their StarkNet wallet
connected, preparing for relayer-based L1 transaction signing.

Test coverage: 100% for new functionality
TDD: Red-Green-Refactor cycle completed

feat: implement T-003 - proper _l2Signer storage behavior

- Do not store _l2Signer in single-parameter mode for StarkNet
- Store _l2Signer in two-parameter mode for backward compatibility
- Maintain existing behavior for other L2 chains (Base, Arbitrum)
- Add comprehensive tests for all storage scenarios
- Add clarifying comment about single-parameter behavior

This change encourages migration to the new single-parameter pattern
while maintaining backward compatibility for existing integrations.

test: enhance single-parameter test suite (T-004)

- Add comprehensive address extraction tests
- Add cross-chain contract creation tests
- Add edge case coverage
- Test various address formats and validation
- Test error scenarios and graceful handling
- Fix TypeScript errors in catch blocks
- Remove unused variable warning

All 20 tests passing with full coverage of single-parameter
initialization scenarios.

feat: enhance StarkNet deposit initialization and error handling

- Added support for single-parameter initialization in `initializeCrossChain` for StarkNet, improving user experience.
- Deprecated the two-parameter pattern while maintaining backward compatibility.
- Implemented retry logic with exponential backoff for relayer requests in `StarkNetDepositorInterface`.
- Enhanced error handling with user-friendly messages for various failure scenarios.
- Updated API reference documentation to reflect changes in method signatures and usage.
- Added tests to cover new functionality and ensure robust integration with existing patterns.

This update streamlines the initialization process and improves reliability when interacting with the relayer service.
chore: formating and docs

refactor: remove StarkNetDepositorInterface and enhance StarkNetDepositor

- Removed the StarkNetDepositorInterface class to streamline the deposit process.
- Enhanced the StarkNetDepositor class with improved configuration options, including default vault and relayer URL.
- Updated the loadStarkNetCrossChainContracts function to utilize the new StarkNetDepositor directly.
- Added new methods for error handling and configuration management in StarkNetDepositor.
- Updated API reference documentation to reflect the removal of the interface and changes in the depositor class.
- Enhanced tests to cover the new functionality and ensure robust integration with existing patterns.

This refactor simplifies the API and improves the user experience when interacting with StarkNet deposits.

feat: update StarkNetL1BitcoinDepositor contract artifacts

- Updated the contract address for StarkNetL1BitcoinDepositor to the newly deployed address.
- Added comprehensive ABI definitions including events and functions for deposit management.
- Enhanced transaction receipt details to include relevant logs and transaction information.
- Included metadata for contract implementation and documentation for better clarity.

This update reflects the latest deployment and improves the contract's usability and integration with the Ethereum ecosystem.
feat: deploy starknetbitcoindepositor to sepolia

feat(starknet): add ownership transfer script and npm commands - Add ownership transfer deployment script for StarkNetBitcoinDepositor - Add transfer-ownership npm scripts for sepolia and mainnet networks - Script uses hardhat-helpers to transfer ownership to governance address

fix(starknet): add local testing support to deployment script - Add hardhat/localhost/development network configuration with mock addresses - Prevents deployment failures during local testing and integration tests - Uses mock StarkGate bridge and tBTC token addresses for local environments
chore(starknet): update sepolia deployment artifacts - Update OpenZeppelin upgrades configuration for sepolia - Update StarkNetBitcoinDepositor deployment record with latest deployment

refactor: update StarkNet interfaces and classes maintaining backwards compatibility

- Renamed and refactored classes and interfaces for clarity, including ArbitrumL2BitcoinDepositor to ArbitrumBitcoinDepositor and L2TBTCToken to DestinationChainTBTCToken.
- Introduced new interfaces such as BitcoinDepositor and ExtraDataEncoder to standardize interactions across different chains.
- Updated API references and documentation to reflect these changes, ensuring consistency and improved usability.
- Deprecated old class names and interfaces while maintaining backward compatibility.
- Enhanced tests to cover the new structure and ensure robust functionality across StarkNet and Arbitrum integrations.

This refactor streamlines the API and improves the developer experience when working with cross-chain deposits.

chore: update StarkNet contract references and improve test coverage

- Updated API documentation to reflect changes in StarkNet contract references, including line number adjustments.
- Added support for a test chain ID in the TBTC_CONTRACT_ADDRESSES for local testing.
- Modified test cases to use updated endpoint URLs and improved error messages for unsupported destination chains.
- Enhanced tests for StarkNet artifacts to differentiate between mainnet and sepolia deployments, ensuring accurate validation of contract properties.

These changes enhance clarity and maintainability of the codebase while improving the testing framework for StarkNet integrations.
Revert "Deploy/starknet btc depositor sepolia"

feat(starknet): add ownership transfer script and npm commands - Add ownership transfer deployment script for StarkNetBitcoinDepositor - Add transfer-ownership npm scripts for sepolia and mainnet networks - Script uses hardhat-helpers to transfer ownership to governance address

fix(starknet): add local testing support to deployment script - Add hardhat/localhost/development network configuration with mock addresses - Prevents deployment failures during local testing and integration tests - Uses mock StarkGate bridge and tBTC token addresses for local environments
chore(starknet): update sepolia deployment artifacts - Update OpenZeppelin upgrades configuration for sepolia - Update StarkNetBitcoinDepositor deployment record with latest deployment

Based on the Lazer relayer, this binary receives incoming update streams from a publisher and sends signed transactions to the Lazer relayer itself.

## Rationale

Ensure very small numbers display properly instead of rounding to zero.

For some symbols, the price or confidence are very small, and the previous formatting code would round very small numbers to zero.

prs.title: fix: don't use nodes which haven't reported us as fallen behind for reconnect
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

When some node has reported us as falling behind, this marker was never cleared, until we have finished full reconnect ourselves. In rare situations, if we managed to get back on our own, then other node was stuck and we again have fallen behind, we might have been chosing broken node for reconnect target, just because it reported issues to us once.

This fix clears the marke

commits.message:
fix: don't use nodes which haven't reported us as fallen behind for reconnect

Signed-off-by: Artur Biesiadowski <artur.biesiadowski@swirldslabs.com>
